thread.title: Football: Clear Brook races past Clear Falls, 63-24
thread.title_full: Football: Clear Brook races past Clear Falls, 63-24

title: Football: Clear Brook races past Clear Falls, 63-24
text:
KIRK SIDES Football: Clear Brook races past Clear Falls, 63-24 
Clear Brook's Brandon Taylor (25) heads to the end zone for one of his two touchdowns Thursday night against Clear Falls. KIRK SIDES Football: Clear Brook races past Clear Falls, 63-24 
Clear Brook's Jarrett Smith (1) powers ahead for yardage against Clear Falls Thursday night. KIRK SIDES Football: Clear Brook races past Clear Falls, 63-24 
Teammates congratulate Clear Falls' Sam Draper after Draper recovered a fumble and took it into the end zone for a touchdown against Clear Brook Thursday night. KIRK SIDES Football: Clear Brook races past Clear Falls, 63-24 
Clear Falls' Jared Ford (11) sprints down the sideline against Clear Brook Thursday night. Advertisement Football: Clear Brook races past Clear Falls, 63-24 
LEAGUE CITY -- Clear Brook scored on seven plays of 39 yards or more Thursday night to erase an early 14-0 deficit and take a 63-24 win over Clear Falls in a District 24-6A football game. 
The win keeps Clear Brook (2-6, 2-3) still in the hunt for a playoff spot while Clear Falls fell to its eighth defeat in as many games. 
The Knights took a 14-0 lead on Sam Draper’s 25-yard fumble return and his 7-yard TD run. 
However, Clear Brook tied the game at 14 by the end of the opening quarter on Brandon Taylor’s 75-yard TD reception from Mark Milton and Taylor’s 91-yard punt return for a score. 
The Wolverines stretched the lead to 28-14 by halftime on Tywon Mackey’s 47-yard interception return for a touchdown and Caleb Chapman’s 49-yard scoring reception from Milton. 
In the third quarter, Brook tacked on three more scores on Milton’s 94-yard TD run, his 42-yard TD pass to Russell Hall, and a 39-yard TD run from Jarrett Smith. 
Clear Falls countered with Kendon Flowers’ 5-yard scoring run, but the Knights’ trailed 49-21 entering the fourth quarter. 
Brook added scoring runs by Stephen Rowe and Tim Thompson while the Kinghts’ added a 40-yard field goal from Marshall Hart.
